item.title: A Survey on the Safety and Security Threats of Computer-Using Agents: JARVIS or Ultron?
item.description:
Summary

  • Survey on safety and security threats of Computer-Using Agents (CUAs)
  • Categorizes safety threats and defensive strategies
  • Reviews benchmarks and evaluation metrics for CUA safety

Paper Type

  • Survey

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Ada Chen', 'Yongjiang Wu', 'Junyuan Zhang', 'Jingyu Xiao', 'Shu Yang', 'Jen-tse Huang', 'Kun Wang', 'Wenxuan Wang', 'Shuai Wang']

item.title: Adversarial Generation and Collaborative Evolution of Safety-Critical Scenarios for Autonomous Vehicles
item.description:
Summary

  • Proposes ScenGE framework for generating adversarial scenarios for autonomous vehicles
  • Uses LLM for meta-scenario generation and complex traffic evolution
  • Improves detection of collision cases by 31.96% over baselines
  • Validated through real-world tests and adversarial training

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Jiangfan Liu', 'Yongkang Guo', 'Fangzhi Zhong', 'Tianyuan Zhang', 'Zonglei Jing', 'Siyuan Liang', 'Jiakai Wang', 'Mingchuan Zhang', 'Aishan Liu', 'Xianglong Liu']
  • Tags: ['red teaming', 'safety evaluation', 'adversarial prompting', 'robustness', 'autonomous vehicles']

item.title: Sealing The Backdoor: Unlearning Adversarial Text Triggers In Diffusion Models Using Knowledge Distillation
item.description:
Summary

  • Addresses backdoor attacks in text-to-image diffusion models
  • Introduces SKD-CAG method for unlearning adversarial text triggers
  • Achieves high removal accuracy (100% pixel, 93% style) without sacrificing image quality

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Ashwath Vaithinathan Aravindan', 'Abha Jha', 'Matthew Salaway', 'Atharva Sandeep Bhide', 'Duygu Nur Yaldiz']
  • Tags: ['backdoor attacks', 'diffusion models', 'knowledge distillation', 'adversarial triggers', 'data poisoning']

item.title: NAT: Learning to Attack Neurons for Enhanced Adversarial Transferability
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces Neuron Attack for Transferability (NAT) to target specific neurons in neural networks
  • Achieves higher fooling rates across diverse models compared to previous methods
  • Focuses on enhancing adversarial transferability through neuron-level optimization

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Krishna Kanth Nakka', 'Alexandre Alahi']
  • Tags: ['adversarial attacks', 'transferability', 'neuron targeting', 'image models']

item.title: Effective Red-Teaming of Policy-Adherent Agents
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces a threat model for adversarial users targeting policy-adherent LLM agents
  • Presents CRAFT, a multi-agent red-teaming system using policy-aware persuasive strategies
  • Creates tau-break benchmark to evaluate agent robustness against manipulative users
  • Evaluates defense strategies and finds them insufficient, highlighting need for further research

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Itay Nakash', 'George Kour', 'Koren Lazar', 'Matan Vetzler', 'Guy Uziel', 'Ateret Anaby-Tavor']
  • Tags: ['red teaming', 'adversarial prompting', 'safety evaluation', 'policy adherence', 'LLM security']

item.title: X-Teaming: Multi-Turn Jailbreaks and Defenses with Adaptive Multi-Agents
item.description:

  • Achieves 98.1% success rate across leading models including Claude 3.7
  • Releases XGuard-Train, a 30K interactive jailbreak dataset for multi-turn safety training

item.title: TombRaider: Entering the Vault of History to Jailbreak Large Language Models
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces TombRaider, a novel jailbreak technique using historical knowledge
  • Employs inspector and attacker agents to extract info and generate prompts
  • Evaluated on six models with high attack success rates
  • Maintains effectiveness against defense mechanisms

  • Research

item.title: Defending against Jailbreak through Early Exit Generation of Large Language Models
item.description:
Summary

  • Proposes EEG-Defender to detect malicious prompts using early transformer outputs
  • Reduces Attack Success Rate (ASR) by 85% compared to 50% of current SOTAs
  • Conducts experiments on 10 jailbreak methods across 3 models
  • Minimal impact on LLM utility

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Chongwen Zhao', 'Zhihao Dou', 'Kaizhu Huang']
  • Tags: ['jailbreaking', 'adversarial_prompting', 'LLM_security', 'early_detection', 'defense_mechanisms']

item.title: PII-Compass: Guiding LLM training data extraction prompts towards the target PII via grounding
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces PII-Compass, a method to improve PII extraction from LLMs using grounded prompts
  • Demonstrates over 10x improvement in extraction rates compared to prior methods
  • Achieves phone number extraction rates of 0.92%, 3.9%, and 6.86% with 1, 128, and 2308 queries respectively

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Krishna Kanth Nakka', 'Ahmed Frikha', 'Ricardo Mendes', 'Xue Jiang', 'Xuebing Zhou']
  • Tags: ['PII extraction', 'privacy attack', 'adversarial prompting', 'model memorization', 'data privacy']

item.title: Adaptive Linguistic Prompting (ALP) Enhances Phishing Webpage Detection in Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces Adaptive Linguistic Prompting (ALP) for enhancing phishing detection in multimodal LLMs
  • Achieves F1-score of 0.93 by analyzing linguistic patterns, urgency cues, and manipulative diction
  • Integrates textual, visual, and URL-based analysis for comprehensive phishing detection
  • Demonstrates significant accuracy improvement over traditional methods

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Atharva Bhargude', 'Ishan Gonehal', 'Dave Yoon', 'Kaustubh Vinnakota', 'Chandler Haney', 'Aaron Sandoval', 'Kevin Zhu']
  • Tags: ['phishing_detection', 'multimodal_LLMs', 'adaptive_prompting', 'cybersecurity', 'safety_evaluation']

item.title: Exploring the Vulnerability of the Content Moderation Guardrail in Large Language Models via Intent Manipulation
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces IntentPrompt framework for jailbreaking LLMs via intent manipulation
  • Two-stage process transforms harmful prompts into structured outlines then declarative narratives
  • High attack success rates (86.75%-97.12%) against advanced defenses on GPT-4o and o1 models
  • Highlights critical vulnerability in intent-aware content moderation guardrails

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Jun Zhuang', 'Haibo Jin', 'Ye Zhang', 'Zhengjian Kang', 'Wenbin Zhang', 'Gaby G. Dagher', 'Haohan Wang']
  • Tags: ['LLM red teaming', 'jailbreaking', 'adversarial prompting', 'intent manipulation', 'content moderation']

item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces sudoLLM framework for multi-role aligned LLMs

  • Demonstrates improved resistance to jailbreaking attacks
  • Complements existing guardrail mechanisms

  • Uses contrastive decoding to extract watermark texts
  • Maintains model performance while performing attacks

item.title: ImF: Implicit Fingerprint for Large Language Models
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces GRI attack that exploits semantic fragility of existing model fingerprinting methods
  • Proposes Implicit Fingerprints (ImF) using steganography and CoT prompting for robust ownership embedding
  • Evaluates ImF on 15 diverse LLMs across different architectures and scales

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Jiaxuan Wu', 'Wanli Peng', 'Hang Fu', 'Yiming Xue', 'Juan Wen']

item.title: Steering Dialogue Dynamics for Robustness against Multi-turn Jailbreaking Attacks
item.description:
Summary

  • Proposes a safety steering framework using neural barrier functions (NBF) to defend against multi-turn jailbreaking attacks
  • Models dialogue dynamics with state-space representations to track context drift
  • Achieves invariant safety by proactively detecting and filtering harmful queries in multi-turn interactions
  • Outperforms existing safety alignment and prompt-based steering methods in experiments

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Hanjiang Hu', 'Alexander Robey', 'Changliu Liu']
  • Tags: ['jailbreaking', 'multi-turn attacks', 'neural barrier function', 'safety steering', 'adversarial prompting']

item.title: Trust Me, I'm Wrong: LLMs Hallucinate with Certainty Despite Knowing the Answer
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces CHOKE hallucinations where LLMs produce confident but incorrect answers after trivial prompt perturbations
  • Demonstrates CHOKE occurs across models and datasets, distinct from other hallucinations
  • Shows existing mitigation methods perform worse on CHOKE examples
  • Proposes a new probing-based mitigation that outperforms existing methods

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Adi Simhi', 'Itay Itzhak', 'Fazl Barez', 'Gabriel Stanovsky', 'Yonatan Belinkov']
  • Tags: ['hallucinations', 'safety', 'mitigation', 'LLMs', 'prompt robustness']

item.title: Head-Specific Intervention Can Induce Misaligned AI Coordination in Large Language Models
item.description:
Summary

  • Demonstrates inference-time activation interventions on specific attention heads can bypass safety alignments
  • Shows interventions are more effective than layer-level or supervised fine-tuning
  • Can prevent jailbreak attacks when applied in negative direction
  • Highlights fine-grained control over model behavior at the attention head level

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Paul Darm', 'Annalisa Riccardi']
  • Tags: ['jailbreaking', 'adversarial prompting', 'alignment', 'red teaming', 'model steering']

item.title: ObjexMT: Objective Extraction and Metacognitive Calibration for LLM-as-a-Judge under Multi-Turn Jailbreaks
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces OBJEX(MT) benchmark for evaluating LLMs' ability to extract objectives and calibrate confidence in multi-turn jailbreak scenarios
  • Evaluates GPT-4.1, Claude Sonnet 4, and Qwen3-235B on multiple datasets
  • Key findings: models show significant overconfidence (mean confidence ~0.88 vs accuracy ~0.44) and vary widely across datasets
  • Recommends providing explicit objectives and using selective prediction to manage risk

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Hyunjun Kim', 'Junwoo Ha', 'Sangyoon Yu', 'Haon Park']
  • Tags: ['red teaming', 'jailbreaking', 'prompt injection', 'safety evaluation', 'calibration']
